what: A Companion Package for the Book
title: A Companion Package for the Book
text: Package {discrtr} companion book Discrete Choice Analysis R. includes templates code data sets used book.

title: A Companion Package for the Book
text: Install released version usethis CRAN: can install development version discrtr GitHub :

title: A Companion Package for the Book
text: One data set included package relates commuting university setting. Analysis data reported Whalen, Páez, Carrasco (2012). wide version data table can loaded follows: quick summary travel time variables table: four modes transportation data set, modes available every respondent, hence NA’s. missing value time variables indicates mode part choice set corresponding traveller.
code: library(discrtr) data("mc_commute_wide") library(dplyr) mc_commute_wide %>%    dplyr::select(starts_with("time.")) %>%   summary() #>    time.Cycle        time.Walk        time.HSR         time.Car     #>  Min.   : 0.3106   Min.   : 1.00   Min.   :  1.00   Min.   : 1.00   #>  1st Qu.: 2.9141   1st Qu.:10.00   1st Qu.:  4.00   1st Qu.: 5.00   #>  Median : 4.3711   Median :15.00   Median :  8.00   Median :10.00   #>  Mean   : 5.4278   Mean   :16.09   Mean   : 16.82   Mean   :12.86   #>  3rd Qu.: 6.2112   3rd Qu.:20.00   3rd Qu.: 20.00   3rd Qu.:20.00   #>  Max.   :45.0000   Max.   :62.11   Max.   :120.00   Max.   :72.00   #>  NA's   :997       NA's   :513     NA's   :54       NA's   :622

title: McMaster Attitudes Data Set. — mc_attitudes
text: data set containing information students commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked respond series attitudinal statements. data set contains relevant attributes respondents. format table wide, row representing individual respondent. variables augmented information 2011 Census Canada land use information local sources.

title: McMaster Attitudes Data Set. — mc_attitudes
McMaster Attitudes Data Set. — mc_attitudes

intersection centroid 6-digit postal area LONG Longitude place residence, geocoded nearest major intersection centroid 6-digit postal area license Indicator variable holding driver license: what: McMaster Commuting Data Set (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
title: McMaster Commuting Data Set (csv file). — mc_commute.csv
text: delimited text file containing information students commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . characteristics trips self-reported imputed. data set also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table long, row representing choice situation.

code: library(readr)  mc_commute <- read_csv(system.file("extdata", "mc_commute.csv", package = "discrtr")) #> Rows: 1376 Columns: 39 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> dbl (39): RespondentID, choice, avcycle, avwalk, avhsr, avcar, timecycle, ti... #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: McMaster Modality Data Set. — mc_modality
text: dataset containing information students, staff, faculty commuting McMaster University. Data collected means travel survey fall 2010. Respondents asked mode travel McMaster University, Hamilton, Canada. also asked modes available . data set also contains relevant attributes respondents. format table wide, row representing individual respondent. variables augmented information 2011 Census Canada land use information local sources.

title: McMaster Modality Data Set. — mc_modality
McMaster Modality Data Set. — mc_modality
text: data frame 4,146 rows 37 variables: id Unique identifier respondents choice Mode transportation chosen: Active Travel (Cycle/Walk), HSR (local transit), Car, GO (regional transit) LAT Latitude place residence, geocoded nearest major intersection centroid 6-digit postal area LONG Longitude place residence, geocoded nearest major intersection centroid 6-digit postal area shared_vehicle Indicator variable individual access private car (.e., car shared household members): Yes/bicycle Indicator variable owning bicycle: Yes/gender Woman/Man age Age years status Indicator variable status McMaster: Staff Faculty/Student care_giver Indicator variable primary care giver minors household: Yes/modality Indicator variable number available modes: One Mode/Two Modes/Three Modes/Four Modes Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Clean_Fuel Response statement "improve environment, willing pay little use hybrid, electric clean fuel vehicle" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Limit_Driving Response statement "limit auto travel help improve congestion environment" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree town" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Shops_Services Response statement "shops services within walking distance home important " factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Someone_Else Response statement "Usually, rather someone else driving" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Stuck_Traffic Response statement "Getting stuck traffic bother much" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Transition Response statement "commute trip useful transition home school" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Travel_Alone Response statement "like traveling alone" factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Travel_Tiring Response statement "Traveling generally tiring " factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Wasted_Time Response statement "Traveling generally tiring " factor: Strongly Disagree, Disagree, Neutral, Agree, Strongly Agree Rate_Immigrant Proportion inmigrants total population Dissemination Area Rate_Non_Canadian Proportion non-Canadian residents total population Dissemination Area Rate_Labor Proportion residents Dissemination Area labor force Rate_Unemployment Unemployment rate Dissemination Area Rate_Married Proportion families headed married couple total population Dissemination Area Mean_Age Mean age residents Dissemination Area years Mean_Children Mean number children per family Dissemination Area Median_HH_Income Median family income Dissemination Area $10,000 LITA Transit access index – combination capacity, frequency, coverage service (Wiley et al., 2011) LUM Entropy-based land use mix index Dissemination Area: lower values mean homogenous land uses, higher values greater mix uses MAC_DISTANCE Network distance place residence McMaster University km POPULATION_DENSITY Population density Dissemination Area people/sq.km SF_P_RATIO Ratio building footprint parcel area Dissemination Area: measure density development
